1425094.sentence: The light had changed: as well as the cold anbaric gleam from the zeppelins’ floodlights, there was the leaping orange of flames. Will looked back once.

1425237.sentence: In the glare Mrs. Coulter’s face was a mask of tragic passion, and her dæmon clung piteously to her as she knelt and held out her arms, crying:

1425398.sentence: “Lyra! Lyra, my love! My heart’s treasure, my little child, my only one! Oh, Lyra,  Lyra, don’t go, don’t leave me! My darling daughter—you’re tearing my heart—”

1425576.sentence: And a great and furious sob shook Lyra herself, for, after all, Mrs. Coulter was the only mother she would ever have, and Will saw a cascade of tears run down the girl’s cheeks.

1425771.sentence: But he had to be ruthless. He pulled at Lyra’s hand, and as the dragonfly rider darted close to his head, urging them to hurry, he led her at a crouching run down the path and away from the cave.

1425874.sentence: In Will’s left hand, bleeding again from the blow he’d landed on the monkey, was Mrs. Coulter’s pistol.

1426094.sentence: Mindful of those sharp spurs, Will said nothing, though he hadn’t the least intention of obeying.

1426249.sentence: There was only one place he was making for, and that was the window behind the bush; so he kept his head low and ran fast, and Lyra and Ama ran behind him.

1426710.sentence: But someone else came from nowhere to help them: Balthamos, in a blur of desperation, hurled himself between the children and the soldiers.

1426991.sentence: But they were trained warriors, and a moment later their dæmons leapt at the angel, savage teeth flashing white in the gloom—and Balthamos flinched: he cried out in fear and shame, and shrank back.

1427150.sentence: Will watched in dismay as the figure of his guide and friend soared up to vanish out of sight among the treetops.

1427198.sentence: Lyra was following it all with still-dazed eyes.

1427515.sentence: It had taken no more than two or three seconds, but it was enough for the Swiss to regroup, and now their leader was raising his crossbow, and Will had no choice: he swung up the pistol and clamped his right hand to the butt and pulled the trigger, and the blast shook his bones, but the bullet found the man’s heart.

1427715.sentence: Simultaneously the two little spies launched themselves at the other two, leaping from the dragonflies at their victims before Will could blink.

1428018.sentence: Will leapt over the bodies, and Lyra went with him, running hard and fast with Pantalaimon racing wildcat-formed at their heels.

1428109.sentence: Where’s Ama? Will thought, and he saw her in the same moment dodging down a different path.

1428265.sentence: He seized Lyra’s arm and pulled her toward it.

1428652.sentence: And the first thing Will did was to hold his stomach and retch, heaving and heaving with a mortal horror.

1428770.sentence: That was two men now that he’d killed, not to mention the youth in the Tower of the Angels ... Will did not want this.

1429016.sentence: Lyra watched helpless nearby, nursing Pan, rocking him against her breast.

1429066.sentence: Will finally recovered a little and looked around.

1429536.sentence: Their eyes were so bright and their features so distinct that there was no doubt about their feelings, and Will knew they were a formidable pair, whoever they were.

1429835.sentence: “Oh, Will—I did so hope you’d find it—whatever happened? Did you find your father? And my dream, Will—it’s too much to believe, what we got to do, oh, I daren’t even think of it ... And it’s safe! You brung it all this way safe for me ...”

1430106.sentence: Will thought: It’ll tell us how to mend the knife!

1430268.sentence: “We should move away from this window,”  Will said,

1430470.sentence: she said, and they moved up the slope, Will carrying his rucksack and Lyra happily carrying the little bag she kept the alethiometer in.

1430588.sentence: Out of the corner of his eye, Will saw the two small spies following, but they kept their distance and made no threat.

1430817.sentence: Over the brow of the rise there was a ledge of rock that offered a narrow shelter, and they sat beneath it, having carefully checked it for snakes, and shared some dried fruit and some water from Will’s bottle. Will said quietly,

1431228.sentence: “The knife’s broken. I don’t know how it happened. Mrs. Coulter did something, or said something, and I thought of my mother and that made the knife twist, or catch, or—I don’t know what happened. But we’re stuck till we can get it mended. I didn’t want those two little people to know, because while they think I can still use it, I’ve got the upper hand. I thought you could ask the alethiometer, maybe, and—”

1431562.sentence: Looping back the hair behind her ears, just as Will had seen  her mother do, she began to turn the wheels in the old familiar way, and Pantalaimon, mouse-formed now, sat on her knee.

1431694.sentence: She had hardly started before she gave a little gasp of excitement, and she looked up at Will with shining eyes as the needle swung.

1431923.sentence: “Iorek? Is he nearby, Will? I thought I heard you call him, but then I thought I was just wishing. Is he really?”

1432094.sentence: “Oh, he can do anything with metal, Will! Not only armor—he can make little delicate things as well ...”

1432197.sentence: She told him about the small tin box Iorek had made for her to shut the spy-fly in. “But where is he?”

1432331.sentence: “Close by. He would have come when I called, but obviously he was fighting ... And Balthamos! Oh, he must have been so frightened ...”

1432769.sentence: “Everything you did since she caught me. Oh, Will, you en’t still bleeding? Your poor hand ...”

1432906.sentence: “No. My father cured it. I just opened it up when I hit the golden monkey, but it’s better now. He gave me some ointment that he’d made—”

1433302.sentence: He let her clean his wound and put on some fresh ointment from the little horn box while he told her some of what had happened: the fight with the stranger, the revelation that came to them both a second before the witch’s arrow struck home, his meeting with the angels, his journey to the cave, and his meeting with Iorek.

1433518.sentence: “D’you know, I think she was kind to me, Will—I think she was—I don’t think she ever wanted to hurt me ... She did such bad things, but ...”  She rubbed her eyes.

1434772.sentence: “Oh, but my dream, Will—I can’t tell you how strange it was! It was like when I read the alethiometer, all that clearness and understanding going so deep you can’t see the bottom, but clear all the way down. “It was ... Remember I told you about my friend Roger, and how the Gobblers caught him and I tried to rescue him, and it went wrong and Lord Asriel killed him? “Well, I saw him. In my dream I saw him again, only he was dead, he was a ghost, and he was, like, beckoning to me, calling to me, only I couldn’t hear. He didn’t want me to be dead, it wasn’t that. He wanted to speak to me. “And ... It was me that took him there, to Svalbard, where he got killed, it was my fault he was dead. And I thought back to when we used to play in Jordan College, Roger  and me, on the roof, all through the town, in the markets and by the river and down the Claybeds ... Me and Roger and all the others ... And I went to Bolvangar to fetch him safe home, only I made it worse, and if I don’t say sorry, it’ll all be no good, just a huge waste of time. I got to do that, you see, Will. I got to go down into the land of the dead and find him, and ... and say sorry. I don’t care what happens after that. Then we can ... I can ... It doesn’t matter after that.”

1434931.sentence: Will said, “This place where the dead are. Is it a world like this one, like mine or yours or any of the others? Is it a world I could get to with the knife?”

1435441.sentence: “but it’s a strange place, Will ... So strange ... Could we really do that? Could we really go to the land of the dead? But—what part of us does that? Because dæmons fade away when we die—I’ve seen them—and our bodies, well, they just stay in the grave and decay, don’t they?”

1435738.sentence: “Yes. And that’s the ghost.”  Lyra’s eyes blazed. She said,

1435804.sentence: “Maybe we could get Roger’s ghost out. Maybe we could rescue him.”

1436008.sentence: But if they didn’t get the knife mended, Will thought, they’d be able to do nothing at all.

1436463.sentence: “I am the Lady Salmakia, and my companion is the Chevalier Tialys. We are spies for Lord Asriel.”

1436576.sentence: She was standing on a rock three or four paces away from Will and Lyra, distinct and brilliant in the moonlight.

1437012.sentence: “What world do you come from?”  said Lyra. “I never seen people like you before.”

1437069.sentence: “Our world has the same problems as yours,”  said Tialys.

1437164.sentence: “We are outlaws. Our leader, Lord Roke, heard of Lord Asriel’s revolt and pledged our support.”

1437257.sentence: “And what did you want to do with me?” “To take you to your father,”  said the Lady Salmakia.

1437384.sentence: “Lord Asriel sent a force under King Ogunwe to rescue you and the boy and bring you both to his fortress. We are here to help.”

1437669.sentence: Lyra couldn’t help it: she laughed out loud at the notion of these tiny people making her do anything. But it was a mistake.

1437802.sentence: Moving suddenly, the woman seized Pantalaimon, and holding his mouse body in a fierce grip, she touched the tip of a spur to his leg.

1437878.sentence: Lyra gasped: it was like the shock when the men at Bolvangar had seized him.

1438096.sentence: But then she saw that Will had swept up the man in his right hand, holding him tightly around the legs so he couldn’t use his spurs, and was holding him high.

1438168.sentence: “Stalemate again,”  said the Lady calmly. “Put the Chevalier down, boy.”

1438383.sentence: Lyra saw with a cold thrill that Will was perfectly ready to dash the Gallivespian’s head against the rock. And both little people knew it.

1438655.sentence: His bared teeth were a hand’s breadth from the Lady’s face, and she gazed at him with perfect composure.

1438791.sentence: After a moment he turned and fled to Lyra’s breast, ermine-shaped, and Will carefully placed Tialys back on the rock beside his partner.

1438851.sentence: “You should show some respect,”  the Chevalier said to Lyra.

1439114.sentence: “I’m sorry, I will. Honest.” “As for you—”  he went on, turning to Will. But Will interrupted:

1439383.sentence: “As for me, I’m not going to be spoken to like that, so don’t try. Respect goes two ways. Now listen carefully. You are not in charge here; we are. If you want to stay and help, then you do as we say. Otherwise, go back to Lord Asriel now. There’s no arguing about it.”

1439594.sentence: Lyra could see the pair of them bristling, but Tialys was looking at Will’s hand, which was on the sheath at his belt, and she knew he was thinking that while Will had the knife, he was stronger than they were.

1439959.sentence: “I’ll tell you. We’re going back into Lyra’s world as soon as we’ve rested, and we’re going to find a friend of ours, a bear. He’s not far away.”

1440012.sentence: “The bear with the armor? Very well,”  said Salmakia.

1440102.sentence: “We saw him fight. We’ll help you do that. But then you must come with us to Lord Asriel.”

1440177.sentence: “Yes,”  said Lyra, lying earnestly, “oh yes, we’ll do that then all right.”

1440596.sentence: “It was only a light sting,”  said Tialys.

1440823.sentence: “I need to talk to Lyra in private,”  said Will.

1442279.sentence: How lucky Will was that she was awake now to look after him!

1442544.sentence: When she thought of that, she felt warm and virtuous, because she did it for Will, never for herself.

1443072.sentence: Will and Lyra slept through the night and woke up when the sun struck their eyelids.

1443224.sentence: They actually awoke within seconds of each other, with the same thought; but when they looked around, the Chevalier Tialys was calmly on guard close by.

1443368.sentence: “Mrs. Coulter is in the hands of King Ogunwe, and on her way to Lord Asriel.”

1443757.sentence: “to my commander, Lord Roke, and he has agreed that we should go with you to the bear, and that once you have seen him, you will come with us. So we are allies, and we shall help you as much as we can.”

1444033.sentence: Will took out his last few dried peaches and the stale flat loaf of rye bread, which was all he had left, and shared it among them, though of course the spies did not take much.

1444230.sentence: “Then we better do that soon,”  said Lyra.

1445085.sentence: Only Will could feel exactly where the edges were, and he did it cleanly and quickly.

1445146.sentence: “How many worlds can you enter with the knife?”  said Tialys.

1445181.sentence: “As many as there are,”  said Will.

1446486.sentence: “I hope that little girl’s all right,”  said Will.
